definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: hide, treasure up (NH id.; TelAm. ṣapânu; set, of sun);—

trans. hide, c. acc. pers. Ex 2:2 (E), Jos 2:4 (JE), of hiding a quarrelsome woman, like hiding wind Pr 27:16, Pr 27:16 (si vera 1.; cf. Toy); of ´[[י]]'s hiding his servants (from evil) Ps 27:5, Ps 31:21: = treasure up a thing, Pr 10:14, + [[אִתְְּ]] with thyself, in thine own keeping Pr 2:1 = Pr 7:1, in ([[ב]]) the heart Job 10:13 (subj. ´[[י]]; of secret purposes), Ps 119:11, cf. Job 23:12; + [[ל]] pers. Pr 13:22, Ct So 7:13, subj. ´[[י]] Pr 21:19 reserve penalty; blessings Ps 31:20, Pr 2:7 + [[טִן]] Job 17:4 thou [God] hast treasured up their heart away from understanding, kept it therefrom; pass., of sin Ho 13:12 (abs.; ‖[[חָרוּר]]); read poss. [[חָפוּן]] for [[חָפוּ]] Job 15:22 treasured up for ([[אֱלֵי]]) the sword (v. I. [[חפה]]); [[חָפוּן]] = treasured, cherished place (i.e.Jerusalem) Ez Eze 7:22; = treasure Ps 17:14 Qr (Kt [[חפינך]], v. [[חפין]]), Job 20:26 (on dub. text v. Bu); pl. of ´[[י]]'s treasured ones, his saints Ps 83:4.
intrans. lie hid, lurk, abs. Ps 56:7, c. [[ל]] pers. Pr 1:11, Pr 1:18 and (of eyes of wicked) Ps 10:8.
